column4: Help!! Can you change the passwd of a user w/o user interaction? how?
thanks
sudo passwd <user> is the only way that I know of to do it is by using root powers
sudo aptitude hold <package>
I tried that and when I rebooted it pegged it as an upgrade again
its not working
http://pastebin.ca/679443 don't mind the edgy repos think iit's when I upgraded the upgrade just comments the edgy repos
it seems to be part of boost
through my readings it is a bug that debian had because of timing, and it appears ubunut inherited it
I've been putting off compiling the new version of boost from source for a while now, but I have no choice now

so in fact ubuntu does have it
WHAT
what version of ubuntu do you have?
